climbs.name: Short, Stubby, A Little To The Left

content.description: Short, left-leaning crack. Hand crack deep inside takes gear, you can get you whole body in the thing or layback it or whatever you like. Stay left near the top, doesn't actually summit the formation. There is plenty of gear anchor opportunity up and left. Walk off on the East side.
content.protection: A couple cams anywhere from .5 - 3 will get you up it. I remember a #3 and some small stuff for the gear anchor.
content.location: Up on the Goat Hill area. When you get up into the alcove it is on the formation up and left can't miss it.

climbs.name: Mad Hatter
climbs.fa: Joe Garcia, Brian Burgess, Manuel Rangel

content.description: Three pitches of varied climbing get you to the top of this formation easily spied from the TT trai and EE trail junction. The first pitch is the crux but the others have their moments too. Avoid crumbly footholds by jamming into right crack; roof above is crux (well protected) then another wide spot at the finish tops it off. Pitch 2 starts wide and a #6 friend protected the start but Brian ran it out in the squeeze above. Last pitch wanders left on a traverse to an awkward mantle and finish on a right facing lay back.
content.protection: double from #2 to #4, single #5,6 maybe a 12" big bro (for 2nd pitch); walk off.
content.location: West face of wall just a bit in the shade starts the route up a left-facing dihedral. Loose rock at start easily managed by jamming the right crack.

content.description: A couple of tall towers and a large west facing dome mark the top of the hill. One formation has been climbed to date but others may have passed this way before...
